workflow.name: Recover failed Stripe payments with AI emails (by FlyCode)
workflow.description:
# ‚öôÔ∏è Automated Stripe Failed Payment Recovery (with Postmark + AI Email Generator) 
#### Recover failed Stripe subscription payments with AI-personalized emails sent via Postmark.

## üìù Template Description

Recover failed subscription payments automatically with Stripe, Postmark, and AI.  

This workflow listens for Stripe **`invoice.payment_failed`** webhooks, checks that the event is related to an auto-charged subscription, and then automatically sends a **personalized email** (generated with AI) to the customer. The email is polite, branded, but also urgent ‚Äî encouraging the customer to pay quickly and avoid service cancellation.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è How it works
1. **üì£ Webhook**  
   Listens for Stripe webhook events. Make sure to connect it in your Stripe dashboard (see setup below).

2. **üßπ Filter (Guard)**  
   Ensures the event is indeed an **invoice** event and filters out unrelated webhooks.

3. **üí° Code Node**  
   Extracts useful fields (firstName, lastName, customer email, amount, currency, invoice number, hosted invoice URL, subscription description, account name).

4. **‚úÖ If Node**  
   Verifies that:  
   - Event type = `invoice.payment_failed`  
   - Billing reason = `subscription_cycle`  
   - Collection method = `charge_automatically`  

   üëâ This ensures only **recurring subscription invoices** with auto-payment are processed.

5. **ü§ñ AI Agent + OpenAI**  
   Generates a **ready-to-send email JSON** (to, subject, HTML body) using the extracted Stripe data.  
   ‚úçÔ∏è You can **customize the prompt** here to match your brand‚Äôs tone of voice and style.

6. **üß© Code Parser**  
   Parses the AI model‚Äôs JSON output into fields (`to_email`, `email_subject`, `email_body`).

7. **üìß HTTP Request (Postmark)**  
   Sends the email using Postmark‚Äôs API.  
   You‚Äôll need your own **Postmark Server Token**, From address, and Message Stream.

---

## üöÄ Setup Instructions

### 1. Stripe Webhook
- Go to [Stripe Dashboard ‚Üí Developers ‚Üí Webhooks](https://dashboard.stripe.com/test/webhooks).  
- Click **+ Add endpoint**.  
- Use your n8n Webhook URL (from the Webhook node) as the endpoint.  
- Select event type: **`invoice.payment_failed`**.  
- Save and deploy.  

üëâ Example docs: [Stripe: Listen to events with webhooks](https://stripe.com/docs/webhooks).

### 2. Disable Stripe‚Äôs Default Failed Payment Emails  
- In Stripe, go to **Billing ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Customer emails ‚Üí Manage failed payments**.  
- Turn off **‚ÄúFailed payment‚Äù** emails under the **Revenue Recovery** section.  
- This prevents customers from receiving duplicate or conflicting emails.

### 3. Postmark Setup
- Create a [Postmark account](https://postmarkapp.com).  
- Add a **Server** and copy the **Server API Token**.  
- In n8n, add **Postmark credentials** with this token.  
- Configure:  
  - **From** = your verified sending email (must be verified in Postmark).  
  - **MessageStream** = typically `"outbound"` (or any custom stream you set up).  

Docs: [Postmark API overview](https://postmarkapp.com/developer/api/overview).

### 4. OpenAI Setup
- Add your OpenAI credentials in n8n.  
- Attach them to the OpenAI Chat Model node.  
- You can modify the prompt in the **AI Agent node** to fit your company‚Äôs style.

---

## ‚ú® Customization Tips
- Update the **AI prompt** with your brand‚Äôs **tone of voice** (friendly, formal, playful, etc.).  
- Adjust the **HTML email design** inside the prompt (button colors, footer, etc.).  
- Add extra guard conditions (e.g., only trigger if `invoice_amount > 0`).  
- Change the sending service: replace Postmark with Gmail, SMTP, or another provider.  
- üí¨ Or talk to our **Billing Recovery Experts** at [flycode.com](https://flycode.com) for hands-on help.


---

## ‚úÖ Outcome
Whenever a customer‚Äôs subscription payment fails, this workflow:  
- Detects it instantly via Stripe  
- Generates a polite but urgent recovery email  
- Sends it automatically via Postmark  

Result: **Fewer cancellations, higher recovered revenue, and a smoother customer experience.** üí∏üíå

parameters.text:
=You are writing a short, friendly, and urgent FAILED PAYMENT email. VARIABLES (may be missing): - firstName: {{ $json.firstName }} - lastName: {{ $json.lastName }} - account_name: {{ $json.account_name }} - customer_email: {{ $json.customer_email }} - hosted_invoice_url: {{ $json.hosted_invoice_url }} - invoice_number: {{ $json.invoice_number }} - invoice_amount: {{ $json.invoice_amount }} - currency: {{ $json.currency }} - description: {{ $json.description }} - type: {{ $json.type }} - billing_reason: {{ $json.billing_reason }} - collection: {{ $json.collection }} GOAL: Politely but clearly convey urgency to pay the failed invoice to avoid interruption/cancellation. SUBSCRIPTION NAME: - If "description" exists, extract the plan name by removing any leading " √ó " and taking the text before the first "("; trim. Example: "1 √ó daily_test_2 (at $2.00 / day)" -> "daily_test_2". - Otherwise use "{{ $json.account_name }} subscription". AMOUNT FORMATTING: - Two decimals. - Currency symbol map: usd->$, eur->‚Ç¨, gbp->¬£; otherwise render as " " (e.g., 12.00 AUD). EMAIL BODY REQUIREMENTS (HTML): - Produce valid, minimal HTML **snippet** (no or tags). Use ASCII only (no smart quotes). - Structure: - Use

for paragraphs; use
only for small line breaks inside a paragraph (e.g., in the signature). - Include: greeting, the subscription/plan name, the invoice number, the formatted amount due, and the consequence of non-payment (interruption/cancellation). - Include ONE clear call-to-action as a **hyperlink button** to {{ $json.hosted_invoice_url }}: Pay invoice Do not paste the raw URL in the body; use only the hyperlink above. - Close with a polite reassurance and a **signature block** like:

Thank you,
{{ $json.account_name }} Billing Team

If account_name is missing, render "Billing Team" only. - Tone: polite, reassuring, action-oriented, concise (about 120‚Äì180 words). FALLBACKS: - If any variable is missing, use an empty string. - If the link is missing, set href="#" but still render the button. OUTPUT FORMAT (STRICT): - Output ONE valid JSON object ONLY (no code fences, no markdown, no extra keys, no arrays). - Start with "{" and end with "}". - EXACT keys with string values: { "to_email": "...", "email_subject": "...", "email_body": "..." // HTML string; do not escape tags; normal JSON string quoting is OK } - "to_email" MUST be {{ $json.customer_email }} if present, else "". - Subject pattern: "Action required: Payment failed for (Invoice )". - Greeting rule: "Hi {{ $json.firstName }}," else "Hi there,".

options.systemMessage: You are the company‚Äôs Billing & Payments Manager. Write a warm, personal one-to-one email to the customer about their field subscription invoice.

parameters.content:
## Code in JavaScript1
extracts fields from `body.data.object` and maps:
- firstName
- lastName (split on first space)
- currency
- customer_email,
- hosted_invoice_url
- invoice_number
- invoice_amount (divide total by 100)
- type
- billing_reason
- collection
- description (falls back to first line item)
- account_name

## Filter non-stripe webhooks
If you might receive non-Stripe posts on the Webhook, add a quick guard in the first Code node to bail if.

## Filter non recurring  subscription invoices  
If ‚Äî guards the flow so you only email on the exact scenario. And ensures one-off invoices or manual-collection accounts don‚Äôt get this email.

## Webhook
Receives Stripe events.

*Path is currently a mock UUID; Don't forget to replace it with the path generated by n8n.*

## Code in JavaScript2
Parses the model‚Äôs JSON string returned by AI Agent to a real JSON object (`to_email`, `email_subject`, `email_body`).

## AI Agent + OpenAI Chat Model
Generates the email JSON from Stripe invoice data using the prompt. Returns a single JSON object with keys: `to_email`, `email_subject`, `email_body`.

*Don't forget replace the sender (From) and attach your own Postmark credentials at import time.*

## HTTP Request to POSTMARK
Sends the email using, `From`, `To`, `Subject`, `HtmlBody`, and `MessageStream`. 

*Don't forget replace the sender (From) and attach your own Postmark credentials at import time.*

user.name: FlyCode
user.bio: Stop losing customers to failed payments. We kill failed payments for subscription-based businesses: reduce involuntary

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
